definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Anna's hummingbirdSlow-motion footage has revealed how a hovering hummingbird is able to cope with wet weather.
sentences.chinese: 慢动作镜头揭示了盘旋中的蜂鸟是如何应付雨水的。

sentences.english: As millions will have seen, by courtesy of the slow motion re-runs, the referee made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 慢动作重放后，数百万人都可以看到裁判错判了。

sentences.english: The issues on your mind unfold clearly, as if they were in slow motion.
sentences.chinese: 你之心结就像是慢动作似之在你之面前清晰地展开。

sentences.english: Turns out, when you’re falling you don’t actually see in slow motion.
sentences.chinese: 原来，当你自由下落时，你并没有真正看到慢动作。

sentences.english: He pantomimes the moves in slow motion.
sentences.chinese: 他又用慢动作演示了一遍动作。

sentences.english: Prison itself is the death penalty. In the slowest of slow motion.
sentences.chinese: 监禁本身就是死刑，以最慢的慢动作执行。

sentences.english: Slow deliberate movements are essential to exercise.
sentences.chinese: 慢动作在运动中是必不可少的。

sentences.english: Red-hot, intense, slow-motion flames shot at ultra high speed.
sentences.chinese: 红热，激烈，慢动作火焰射击超高速。

sentences.english: Rock Pigeon landing in slow motion.

definition: camera lens/camera shot (in a movie etc)/scene
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
scene/tableau/picture/image/screen (displayed by a computer)/(motion picture) frame/field of view
